definition: mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
stick/pole/lever/classifier for long objects such as guns

sentences.english: She won the championship with a performance of 13-under in the four rounds.
sentences.chinese: 她並以4輪低於標準桿13杆的成績順利摘下后冠。

sentences.english: NO00,1. You need to sink this putt to make par.
sentences.chinese: 你這杆要推進才能平標準桿。
這一洞的的標準桿是四杆。

sentences.english: He had eagled the same hole earlier today.
sentences.chinese: 今天早些時候，他低於標準桿兩杆進了同一個洞。

sentences.english: You can still make a birdie laying up.
sentences.chinese: 打短距仍可以低於標準桿一杆入洞的。

sentences.english: The Austria Pama's first hole only splits out the even standard bar.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬的第一洞只打出平標準桿。

sentences.english: Callable securities could be called at different prices than par.
sentences.chinese: 可贖回的證券可稱爲在不同的價格比標準桿。

sentences.english: A comparison of the passages of I-II Kings and I Par .
sentences.chinese: 比較通道的第一和第二國王和我標準桿。
